Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Level 1
Description: NA

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: College Reading & Writing Skills
Description: Description: This course focuses on the reading, writing and critical thinking skills needed for academic and workplace success. Students will analyse, summarize, and discuss a variety of readings and apply the steps of planning, writing, and revising in response to written prompts. This course prepares students for post-secondary writing tasks, research, and documentation. Hours: 42Credits: 3Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Conestoga 101
Description: Description: This self-directed course focuses on introducing new students to the supports, services, and opportunities available at Conestoga College. By the end of this course, students will understand the academic expectations of the Conestoga learning environment, as well as the supports available to ensure their academic success. Students will also be able to identify on-campus services that support their health and wellness, and explore ways to get actively involved in the Conestoga community through co-curricular learning opportunities.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Safety in the Workplace
Description: Description: This course focuses on developing awareness and skills for the student to safely manage and conduct him or herself within a variety of employment settings. Through the units of the course, participants will have the opportunity to enhance their understanding and knowledge of general Health and Safety guidelines, including WHMIS, Fire Safety and Workplace Violence. The unit on Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act will instruct the student on the requirements for Accessible Customer Service and Integrated Accessibility Standard Regulations. General information on Safe Driving, Privacy of Information and Hand Washing will be addressed as well. The course also provides participants with critical information regarding their insurance coverage (WSIB or other) while employed. As well as guidelines to follow in the event of an injury. Participants will receive a printable Record of Completion upon successful conclusion of this course, in order to demonstrate awareness of safe working practices to their employers.Hours: 14Credits: 1Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Cardiovascular Anatomy and Physiology
Description: Description: This course will cover in detail the anatomy and physiology of the cardiovascular system. Topics to be discussed are the blood, heart and blood vessels, hemodynamics, invasive and non-invasive assessment of the cardiovascular system, fetal circulation and lymphatic circulation.Hours: 42Credits: 3Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites: RTH1020, RTH1035

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Field Studies I
Description: Description: This course is an introduction to the role of the Respiratory Therapist in a wide variety of settings. It provides the students with exposure to many areas of practice. The student will be given the opportunity to observe respiratory related skills in a patient care setting.Hours: 28Credits: 1Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites: RTH1010, RTH1020, RTH1055

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Respiratory Anatomy and Physiology
Description: Description: A detailed study of the structure and function of the respiratory system.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Applied Science
Description: Description: This course introduces the student to the basic principles of chemistry, microbiology and physics necessary for the study of Respiratory Therapy. This course also introduces the science behind various diagnostic tests and patient monitoring equipment.Hours: 28Credits: 2Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites: RTH1055

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: General Therapeutics
Description: Description: This course covers key aspects of Respiratory Therapy equipment and therapeutics. This course focuses on the principles and practice of oxygen and aerosol therapy.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Anatomy and Physiology
Description: Description: This course provides learners with an overview of the anatomy and basic physiology of the human body.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning

Name: Electives: General Education

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Level 2
Description: NA

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Introductory Pathophysiology
Description: Description: This course is an introduction into the pathophysiology of diseases and disorders of the human body. Pathophysiology, etiology, diagnosis, clinical manifestations, therapeutic interventions, and outcomes of specified acute and chronic disorders will be discussed.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Patient Care Procedures
Description: Description: This course builds on General Therapeutics continuing to focus on Respiratory Therapy Equipment and therapeutics. This course focuses on the principles and practice of suction therapy, chest drainage and bronchoscopy. It provides the unique opportunity to learn within a combined theory/lab environment.Hours: 56Credits: 4Pre-Requisites: RTH1010, RTH1020, RTH1055, RTH1200CoRequisites: RTH1105, RTH1155

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Patient Evaluation
Description: Description: This course is an introduction to Patient Assessment. The student will learn how to obtain a patient history, perform a comprehensive chest assessment; and to interpret vital signs, basic chest radiography, and common lab tests. An introduction to documentation and 12 lead ECG acquisition is also incorporated. This course has a laboratory component, where the students will be able to practice these skills.Hours: 56Credits: 4Pre-Requisites: RTH1010, RTH1020, RTH1200CoRequisites: RTH1095

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Ventilators I
Description: Description: This course addresses the fundamental theories and principles surrounding mechanical ventilation. Emphasis is on indications for mechanical ventilation, the patient - ventilator circuit, common modes of ventilation, introductory waveform and weaning strategies. Practical experience and application of these concepts are reinforced in a laboratory setting. In addition, the physiology of mechanical ventilation and its effects on body systems is explored.Hours: 70Credits: 5Pre-Requisites: RTH1010, RTH1020, RTH1035, RTH1055CoRequisites: RTH1085

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Field Studies II
Description: Description: This course is an introduction to the role of the Respiratory Therapist in a wide variety of settings. It provides the students with exposure to many areas of practice. The student will be given the opportunity to observe respiratory related skills in a patient care setting. Hours: 28Credits: 1Pre-Requisites: RTH1010, RTH1015, RTH1020, RTH1055, RTH1035CoRequisites: RTH1095, RTH1155

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Professional Practice and Community Populations
Description: Description: This course will cover professional responsibilities, medical ethics and communication issues specific to health care. It will also cover leadership opportunities and administrative duties related to Respiratory Therapy. Psychological, sociological and cultural constructs will be explored as they relate to the care of patients in a variety of patient care settings. Emphasis will be placed on seniors care and mental health.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Level 3
Description: NA

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Pharmacology
Description: Description: This course will introduce the student to essential pharmacological principles in regards to several classes of drugs utilized in Respiratory Therapy; agents covered include bronchodilators, corticosteroids, and cardiac agents among others.Hours: 42Credits: 3Pre-Requisites: RTH1095CoRequisites: RTH2040

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Advanced Practice
Description: Description: This course addresses specialized concepts and practices encountered by Respiratory Therapists. Focus is on emerging trends and evidence informed practice as it relates to Respiratory Therapy. Students will participate in case-based learning focused on cardiopulmonary care, institutional evidence informed practice, and management of patients in community-based settings. Self-directed practical application and skill acquisition will be encouraged to reinforce case-based learning and to prepare the student for simulation and clinical experiences.Hours: 28Credits: 2Pre-Requisites: RTH1115, RTH1155CoRequisites: RTH2040

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Ventilators 2
Description: Description: This course builds on theory from the previous ventilator course and addresses the practical application of mechanical ventilation for the adult patient.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Neonatal and Pediatric Respiratory Care
Description: Description: This course will introduce the student to the concepts of neonatal and pediatric physiology; including fetal development, the transitional differences between infants, children and adults.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Blood Analysis and Diagnostics
Description: Description: This course provides the knowledge, skills, and attitudes required in the area of Blood Gas Analysis and procurement along with cardiodiagnostic procedures.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Cardiodiagnostics
Description: Description: This course addresses the theory for various cardiodiagnostic equipment, procedures and practices currently in use. Emphasis is on hemodynamic monitoring, ECG interpretation, cardiovascular and pulmonary vascular disorders, shock, fluid balance and cardio-diagnostic procedures. Hours: 42Credits: 3Pre-Requisites: RTH1105, RTH1095CoRequisites: RTH2125

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Airway Interventions
Description: Description: This course provides advanced theory and application of skills and equipment required for airway management.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Level 4
Description: NA

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Pulmonary Diagnostics
Description: Description: This course provides the knowledge, skills and attitudes required in the area of pulmonary diagnostics.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Advanced Pathophysiology
Description: Description: An in-depth study and analysis of respiratory disturbances. The course emphasis will be placed on acquiring an understanding of the etiology, pathophysiology, and clinical manifestations of the diseases, thus leading to an understanding of treatment, establishing of therapeutic goals, and a schedule for ongoing assessment.Hours: 42Credits: 3Pre-Requisites: RTH2000, RTH2040, RTH2070, RTH2125, RTH2165, RTH1080 or RTH1085CoRequisites: RTH2055, RTH2105, RTH2140

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Respiratory Care Clinical Simulation
Description: Description: This course introduces students to the clinical and professional practice of Respiratory Therapy through simulation based education, with emphasis on learning though observation, participation, reflection and deliberate practice. Students are provided opportunities to develop the professional skills required of Respiratory Therapists across acute, long-term and community care settingsHours: 70Credits: 5Pre-Requisites: RTH2040, RTH2070, RTH2125, RTH2165, RTH2155CoRequisites: RTH2055, RTH2140

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Anesthesia
Description: Description: An introduction to the basic principles of general anesthesia, anesthetic pharmacology (both inhalation and intravenous), and the equipment utilized. There are sections on surgical risk, patient monitoring, and recovery.Hours: 56Credits: 4Pre-Requisites: RTH2000, RTH2040CoRequisites: RTH2105, RTH2140

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Ventilators 3
Description: Description: This course builds on theory from the previous ventilator courses as well as addresses the practical application of mechanical ventilation for the neonatal patient.

Name: Level 5
Description: NA

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Field Placement (Respiratory Therapy)
Description: Description: The clinical practicum experience occurs over a total of 24 weeks in semester 5 and 6 of the program where the student will observe, practice and demonstrate clinical competency in accordance with the National Competency Framework in a variety of skills and patient care settings.Hours: 960Credits: 32Pre-Requisites: RTH2055, RTH2080, RTH2105, RTH2115, RTH2140CoRequisites: FPLT2040, RTH2190

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Field Placement II (Respiratory Therapy)
Description: Description: The clinical practicum experience occurs over a total of 6 weeks where the student will observe, practice and demonstrate clinical competency in accordance with the National Competency Framework in the paediatric and neonatal populations. These 6 weeks may be scheduled in semester 5 or 6 of the program.Hours: 240Credits: 9Pre-Requisites: RTH2055, RTH2080, RTH2105, RTH2115, RTH2140CoRequisites: FPLT2030, RTH2190

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Practice Consolidation I
Description: Description: The first of two clinical theory courses, this online course provides the student the opportunity to build on previously studied theory and to begin to combine and organize all previous program knowledge. The focus of this course is to reinforce the National Competency Framework in preparation for clinical practice. It also prepares students to challenge the Canadian Board for Respiratory Care (CBRC) exam.Hours: 30Credits: 2Pre-Requisites: RTH2055, RTH2080, RTH2105, RTH2115, RTH2140CoRequisites: FPLT2030, FPLT2040

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Level 6
Description: NA

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Practice Consolidation II
Description: Description: The second of two clinical theory courses, this online course provides a continuing opportunity for students to build on previously studied theory and to continue to combine and organize all previous program knowledge. The focus of this course is to reinforce the National Competency Framework in preparation for clinical practice. It also prepares students to challenge the Canadian Board for Respiratory Care (CBRC) exam.Hours: 30Credits: 2Pre-Requisites: RTH2190CoRequisites:
